"Name's Brock.. Have you come to challenge the Pewter City Gym?" The teen asked.

"Yes, my name's Ash Ketchum from Pallet Town, and I'm here for my first gym battle!"

"Straight to the point I see.." Brock said with a small smile; "Well, Ash, let's see how well you do.. Hope you're ready."

Ash nodded, as he grabbed Pidgeotto's pokeball, and brought him out.

Brock raised an eyebrow at the odd choice.. Something told him the rookie had something up his sleeve, so he knew he'd best not get overconfident despite the type advantage Brock's Pokemon had, especially since ground type moves wouldn't work on Pidgeotto.

"Geodude, your'e up!" Brock threw the pokeball containing the small pebble like Pokemon with muscular arms.

"Geo!"

1152112111112221111111211111.content:
Ash's plan for victory had been relatively simple. Figuring that the gym leaders wouldn't use his strongest Pokemon first, The idea was to at least soften said Pokemon up with Pidgeotto if his flying type wasn't strong enough to beat it. Then Poliwag would be able to clear a win easily enough and have a better chance against whatever Brock's second Pokemon would be.

His 'lessons' with Misty had definitely gotten him to start thinking more. To think, I might have actually tried to win with Pikachu before.

For a moment, everything was quiet, until Brock made the first move: "Geodude, use tackle!"

"geo!"

The battle was on as Ash quickly had Pidgeotto dodge before returning fire with a gust attack to try and knock Geodude back. However the rock was undeterred!

Naturally, Geodude retaliated by throwing a stone at the bird, which he avoided, only to receive a Mega Punch to the face, sending the bird reeling until he regained his senses and up righted himself. Geodude naturally grabbed him with his burly hands and got ready for a Seismic Toss, only to be countered with a Peck Attack to the face. While the bird did manage to get away, the peck to Geodude's face only annoyed the rock type Pokemon rather than do much damage.

Pidgeotto avoided another tackle attack, and transitioned to using Double Team. As he flew at Geodude, his entire body had a white outline around it. And as a result, the bird created multiple copies of himself.

Geodude attempted a tackle, but phased through one of them, leading to him receiving a blow from above, courtesy of Pidgeotto using Quick attack, which allowed him to move at a speed that allowed him to be almost invisible, made more effective when Pidgeotto used the momentum while he focused the full force at his beak while lunging, with the smaller surface area allowing the impact to be more condensed.

The rock type recovered after landing on the field, and went underground using dig. Geodude came out of the ground, finding that Pidgeotto had flown almost all the way to the ceiling, leaving him unable to get any higher. Thus he was ready to use a Mega Punch once again.. And if Pidgeotto tried going down, he'd only find himself getting intercepted by Geodude.

But what he did next made Ash grin with impressment.

After hovering back down a bit, Pidgeotto deftly moved to the side while using both talons to grab Geodude by each one of his muscular forearms, using both his side-flap AND Geodude's momentum to start dive bombing to gain even greater speed. Emphasis on speed, as this tactic required a great deal of it, otherwise Geodude would be able to recover and retaliate.

Like a rocket of feathers and stone, the two sped downwards until Pidgeotto gained sufficient velocity. After pulling up back into a sort of loop, Pidgeotto didn't let the momentum and speed go to waste as he promptly chucked the rock Pokemon into the side of one of the largest rock formations on the field, leaving a Geodude's sized hole.

The battle grew intense with both Pokemon starting to look tired, the unexpected happened. Pidgeotto had just dodged again and Ash had called out for a whirlwind attack to push Geodude further while using Geodude's momentum to get a better result, but got something unexpected instead...

"Pidgeoooo!" As the bird flapped his wings, the gusts of wind suddenly gathered around until it formed a sort of cyclone of sorts.. A literal whirlwind if you will, proceeding to let it engulf Geodude. The centrifugal forces being too much, as the tornado promptly slammed him into the field, hard.

Dexter obviously voiced his commentary.

Twister. A dragon type move. This move allows the user to send a tornado at an opponent.

"Woah, I didn't know you had that attack!" Said Ash.

Brock also looked surprised as he returned Geodude to his pokeball for a well earned rest. "That's the thing about being a trainer I suppose. Pokemon are just full of surprises."

"Yeah, I guess you're right." Turning to his Pidegotto, who had collapsed to the ground in exhaustion, though he was still awake and covered in bruises underneath his feathers..

Ash opted to let him rest rather than send him into the next fight. "Get some rest pal, you've earned it."

Pidgeotto chirped back.

Now it was time for round two. Poliwag vs Onyx. As Brock watched Poliwag stepped up to fight, he suddenly felt himself start to chuckle.

"Hey, what's so funny?!" Ash demanded.

"I don't know why, but for just a second there, I had this weird feeling you were going to try and use Pikachu." That thought suddenly had both Ash and Misty laughing as well. After all, using a small electric mouse to fight a giant snake made out of stone? What sort of idiotic, completely insane fool would do that?

Anyway, before it began, Ash breathed in and out in order to calm himself. As he did, Poliwag looked at him. She nodded in reassurance that she'd give it all she had, giving the trainer her faith in his skills as a battler.

"All right.." Ash grinned; "Let's get this thing started!"

Poliwag started off with a Water Gun, only for Onix to evade with surprising quickness for a Pokemon his size. Likely, this was because of his experiences in gym battles, allowing him to compensate for whatever disadvantage he'd find himself in, especially opponents that were water type Pokemon.

In retaliation, Onix attempted to slap Poliwag with his tail, only for the water type to hit the dirt. While the blow didn't connect in the slightest after she ducked, the strong breeze from how fast it was certainly blew the smaller Pokemon away about a couple meters back. Thankfully, she managed to land on her stubby little feet.

After an attempt to swipe at her with his tail again, she hopped back to get some distance while also launching another water gun. Onix naturally avoided this yet again, and promptly began charging, or would that be slithering?

Poliwag got out of there, knowing that meeting the attack head on was stupid. She could try to run away until he got tired and make himself easer for her to finish him off with a Water Gun or two. But she and her trainer knew that Onix probably wouldn't even tire out that easily.. So instead, this battle would have to be done similarly with Pidgeotto and Geodude's battle.

Thankfully, Poliwag had plenty of places to hide, due to her size, how big the field was, and the plentiful amount of rocks there were on the field!

As Onix went past one of the biggest, he groaned a bit in pain as the side of his head felt a forceful shot of water pelt it. Turning his head to where it came from, he slowly moved towards what looked to be the same rock formation Geodude smashed into, only for the other side of his head to feel the same shot of water that hit him.

With a grimace, Onix turned his head and looked around. Brock knew that Onix's size was a bit of a double edged sword, since it made him a larger target, which is why he had Onix use Dig.

As Poliwag looked around for Onix, she felt a rumbling, about 4 meters to her right. She immediately started running again, only to feel the shockwave resulting from Onix suddenly popping out of the ground in front of her, knocking her back and hitting one of the boulders.

She got to her stubby feet the best that a Pokemon with no arms could, and used her tail to help shake off the dizziness. Only for Onix to come back up again, this time from behind. Poliwag was thrown like a ragdoll, though she landed on her feet this time.

This didn't look good at all, since Onix was now playing the game of guerrilla warefare with Poliwag. Since Onix himself now had a place to hide, there was no telling when he'd pop up again, and he'd more than likely intercept Poliwag again if she tried to run. He wasn't sure if Poliwag could even TAKE much more from this..

Wait a minute.. Ash thought to himself as the gears in his head turned... Until he hit upon an idea.

As Poliwag was gathering her senses, she heard her trainer call out to her. Telling her to run and wait until he said otherwise. Knowing that her trainer had a trick up his sleeve, she began running as fast her little feet could carry her.

As she felt the rumbling in front of her, Ash told her to jump into the air as hard as she could and use Hypnosis. She did so, jumping into the air surprisingly high (likely due to her frog like physiology). As Onix's large head popped up again as if he were playing "Whack-A-Mole" , Poliwag's eyes were glowing blue.

When the rock Pokemon made eye contact with Poliwag, his eyes became dull.

With Onix now in a trance, Poliwag took the initiative and began pelting him with Water Gun after Water Gun, until he was looking like he could collapse. With him just standing there, Poliwag knew this was her chance, hopping onto her opponent's tail and running up his body until she got to the head.

She used it as a platform to hop away, opening her mouth while in mid-air and using Mud Shot, hurling multiple round globs of mud at high speed towards Onix...

As the mud made contact with Onix, Poliwag landed on a pillar of stone, panting a bit as she watched the toppled giant crash to the floor. She was surprised, but glad all the same.

The little thing was so exhausted she was actually happy to get some rest inside her Pokeball..

And just like that?... Ash had effectively won his very first gym battle.

11521121111122222112111211112112111.content:
Ash and Brock stood across from each other, ready to battle. Their brief introduction had been quite pleasant, and Brock was looking forward to seeing what his opponent had in store for him. He wasn't sure what, but something told him that there was something special about this kid.

The first round saw Ash's Pidgeotto go up against Brock's Geodude. Pidgeotto, following Ash's commands, staid up high and moved quickly to avoid any attacks that Geodude sent up. Although sending out attacks that could do enough damage proved to be a bit more difficult, as Geodude seemed able to weather every Gust of wind sent at him, and moving in close for Peck quickly became too risky after the first two attempts. In a surprising turn of events though, Ash managed to wrap up the fight when Pidgeotto, rather than Gust, ended up sending out a Twister attack, knocking the rock type over and out.

The second round proved to be a bit surprising against Onix's endurance when faced against Vaporeon. The stone snake held up against the first water gun sent at it and immediately put Vaporeon on the defensive as it was forced to dodge. Ash had Vaporeon dodging left and right, and even using quick attack to rush away from an Iron Tail. It took several more well timed water gun attacks amidst frantic dodges to finally bring the mighty beast down.

And just like that, Ash had earned his first gym badge.

As Misty and Ash were preparing to leave the gym, Brock stopped to congratulate the younger trainer again. "...and I've gotta say, your Vaporeon, moves surprisingly fast. How did you get her to be that quick?"

Ash rubbed the back of his neck and laughed awkwardly. "Honestly, I think that's all her. I haven't really had the chance to train her for speed yet."

Brock nodded. "Well, Pokemon can get a lot stronger on their own than we sometimes give them credit for."

"Yeah, sometimes it's less about training Pokemon to be stronger and more about figuring out what they can already do and what the best way to do it is." Misty added.

Ash took in this information, knowing that it would be useful later on.

What happens next?

115211211111222221121112111121121111112.content:
"He does have a right to know, after all..." Misty said.

"True..." Ash said.
-

Later, the two made their way back to the gym, where they met up Brock while he was interacting with his nine younger siblings.

What was more surprising, of course, was that Brock was, in fact, the son of the previous gym leader, Flint Slate, who disappeared under mysterious circumstances. And with both parents out of the picture, it was up to Brock, not only to keep the gym running but to also act as the man of the house (at the age of 15); providing the best that he could for his family.

Aside from this, Misty and Ash also made sure to tell him about the salesman.

"How could this guy know about me?" Brock asked. "This sounds pretty suspicious..."

"I know, we feel the same way," Ash said.

"We'll help you find the guy if you want!" Misty said; "Maybe after you two meet, we'll get the answer we need..."
--

After the duo, accompanied by Brock, searched for a while, they finally found the salesman, who was just getting back from the woods. Brock calmly, yet firmly asked the bearded man who he was, how and why he knew about Brock, and what have you.

The bearded man stood there in silence, almost as if he was thinking of what to say to get out of this conversation... Until the three gasped when the man removed his beard and hat, to reveal that he looked almost EXACTLY like Brock, save for being much older, and bigger.

I KNEW there was something familiar about him! Misty thought to herself.

"Dad?!" Brock said; "What? I... Where the hell have you been all this time?! Do you have any idea what I've been through since you were gone?! O-or how much my brothers and sisters felt when you went away?!

"Brock, I... When I failed to become a successful trainer... I couldn't face you all. If I couldn't be good enough to use something other rock type Pokemon... Then what good could I be as the man you and your siblings look up to?"

Brock's fists clenched; "So you left because you thought we'd all be better off without you?! Well, guess what?... That's the biggest load of bullshit I've ever heard! If we really were better off, than we wouldn't be asking ourselves when you'd come home! It doesn't matter whether or not you'd be good enough as a trainer! What mattered to us has always been you being there for us! As a father should! This gym and everyone living in it need you! I don't care how little you think of yourself, I won't let you walk away from your own family again! Not when they need you the most!"

Misty, Pikachu, and Ash stood there, their mouths agape as they listened to Brock chewing out Flint.

"Son..." Flint struggled to find something to say until tears rolled down his cheeks as he looked at his eldest son; "I don't see how you could still need me, even after my failure. Even after I hurt you and the other kids... I'm not just a failure as a trainer... I've failed you as a father."

"I think you haven't looked hard enough..." Brock said, now with a more visibly relaxed posture. "Maybe you failed as a trainer, but you still have a chance as a father. If you really want to make up for everything we went through. Just... Please come home..."

"...All right..."
---

The reunion between Brock's siblings and their father was, suffice to say, emotional.

Flint apologized to everyone for leaving, promising to never leave the way he did again, with conviction in every syllable of his words. And everything settled down, he talked to Brock again.

"Son, I want to thank you and those kids for helping me snap out of my foolishness... You're growing to be a good, strong man. Which is why I want you to do what I never did..."

"Dad, are you saying--"

"Yes, Brock..." Flint said sternly; "I still recall that you have a dream as a Pokemon breeder... And if you want to achieve it, then get out there and show what you're worth. You can't do that by staying here, because to deny you of your passion would be wrong. Besides... I think those kids could use your level-headedness."

Brock looked at him with disbelief, but gave a small smile; "I'll do it...."

Flint gave a smile of his own as he put a hand on his boy's shoulder; "Good... I have a feeling, you're going be something great."
---

Brock met up with Ash and Misty, who were playing with Brock's younger siblings until they saw him.

After Brock told them about his talk with Flint, the two looked at each other with a surprised look on their face, then at the young gym leader.

"You know, now that we've thought about it, I think we have room for our little group," Misty said.

"Pika!" Pikachu said as he leaped onto Ash's shoulders

"You said it, buddy!" Ash said to his Pokemon, scratching him behind the ears.

---

Ash let Pikachu proceed with his checkup while he walked into the room Misty was in, sitting on a bed with her shoes off while she hugged her legs.

"Mist? You feeling okay?" Ash asked as he walked in, closing the door behind him.

"I'm fine Ash... Just go and prepare for your gym battle!" Misty said.

"You didn't sound fine then, and you don't now!" Ash said.

Something was definitely wrong, considering Misty didn't tell him to take his pants off; "If anything, you looked like you didn't want to go to the gym..."

"Well, I-"

"Misty, please talk to me! I wanna help with what's bugging you! You've been helping me so much, and now I want to return even a quarter of all you've done for me!"

Misty looked at the boy as he pleaded with her. After some thought, Misty got off the bed; "Do you really wanna know?..."

"I won't stop asking until you do..." Ash said.

"All right I'll talk," Misty said

"But first things first, your undies..." Ash said

Misty sighed and nodded turning around and lifting up her yellow shirt so he could see the waistband of her panties. It didn't take long for her to feel Ash's fingers grip them, nor for her to squeal in discomfort as the boy hoisted her off the floor.

Ash sat across from Misty on a separate bed, while the girl in question was sitting with the back of her underpants pulled over her eyes and hooked under her nose. She winced a bit from the way her cotton dug into her crack but it didn't stop her from telling her story

"All right... The reason I was against going to the gym is related to the reason I specialize in water Pokemon..." Misty's voice trembled with hesitation; "Um... Ever heard of the Sensational Sisters?"

"Don't they put on those shows with water Pokemon?' Ash said

"Yeah, but they're also in charge of the Cerulean gym..." Misty said; "Which is why I have water pokemon... They're my older sisters..."

Ash's jaw dropped.

"See... My relationship with them is strained... For a lack of a better word. Doesn't exactly help that a couple of people have compared me to them. They're oh so graceful and beautiful, whereas I'm the tomboy that wields a mallet and is only really good barely beating them at wedgie wars. Which is why I decided to run away and strike out on my own..." Misty sighed.

"Mist... I... Never realized that you've gone through that..." Ash said, his demeanor softening. ".... You know what? The people that compare you with your sisters... They clearly haven't stopped to get to know you as I've been... First, you're an awesome water Pokemon trainer, probably even way better than your sisters! Second... You've been helping me grow as a trainer for the last few days. I don't know how I could've gone so far without your guidance! Heck, I'm surprised you saw anything worthwhile in me..."

And not that Ash would say it, but he actually was growing fond of Misty's tomboyish attitude.

Despite being in an atomic wedgie Misty smiled as she walked over and pulled him up into a hug; "You have no idea how much I needed to hear that..."

As she did Ash then undid Misty's wedgie
1152112111112222211211121111211211111121.title: She'll agree to talk, but he wants to wedgi...

choices: Let Ash take the badge for now and make him earn it later
1152112111112222211211121111211211111121.content:
Meeting Misty's sisters was, in a word, crazy. Oh getting to them was no problem. The actual problem was, eh, well...

"You're seriously just handing over the badge?!" Ash and Brock had cautiously backed away as the words exploded from Misty.

Her sisters, however, seemed to be completely unperturbed. Although I have no idea how? And how have I been able to give her wedgies without facing this? Ash thought.

"Sister dear," began Violet, "it's not like that would be much different from trying to battle right now."

"Yes," chimed in Daisy, "even if we did have a couple more Pokemon to go with Goldeen, that Pikachu of his alone would practically guarantee him the win."

"We don't expect you to understand, of course," Lily added. "Running a gym is exhausting. Why do you think we're backstroking away from it?"

Misty was practically grinding her teeth. "Grrrr!" I know my sisters aren't exactly ideal, but there's that, and there's nonsense like this! Seriously, just giving away a badge!

"Should we do something?" Ash whispered to Brock.

"Remember earlier when I told you it's okay to sometimes?" he whispered back. Ash nodded. "This isn't one of those times." Ash wasn't going to argue with that.

Lily, meanwhile, was smugly wrapping up her point. "Now unless you know of some other way to settle this, I suggest you just let your little boyfriend take the badge already."

"Speaking of little..." Violet as she looked at Ash; "He's a bit of a runt, Mist... Don't you like, want someone taller?"

Ash looked a bit miffed at the jabs to his height.

"He's not- grdiruh..." her words quickly turned into completely unintelligible grumbling. She took a deep breath, an idea for what to do forming in her head. ",,,Dah, Ash!" The boy jumped as his redheaded companion shouted his name.

"Uh, yeah," he replied swiftly.

"You agree that you should have to battle for the badge, right?!"

"Uh, well, yeah. I mean it would be kinda disappointing. I'd rather actually earn it. But, well..." he sheepishly gestured to her sisters. "I'm all for it if you've got another idea though."

As a matter of fact, she did. She was just taking a moment to wonder if she should actually do it. On one hand, having him battle her for it would give him the perfect chance to actually earn the badge and let her prove her skills to her sister. I'd definitely do a lot better than they would. But at the same time, she was tempted to just not. After all, she'd hardly be making her point if she lost, and she wouldn't want Ash to lose the battle either. Besides, my sisters aren't really setting a very high bar for me to live up to right now. And as for earning the badge, well, I'll have to think of something."

What does Misty decide?
1152112111112222211211121111211211111121.title: They eventually, arrive at the gym, where Ash m...

choices: Ash shows Misty what he's learned
1152112111112222211211121111211211111121.content:
It was then that Misty decided.

"Okay here's what I've decided... Instead of battling my sisters.." Misty turned to Ash and pointed a thumb at herself; "You'll be battling me!"

Ash looked at her with a dumbfounded yet nervous look Misty saw how he reacted and realized that it was because of the two advantages she had over him.

First of all, Misty was a much more skilled battler than Ash was, along with having more experience than he did. Heck, the only reason he did so well at Pewter gym was because Brock, despite being more experienced than he was, didn't expect Ash to be as skilled as he was.

Second, she was still his coach/mentor. Considering they'd been traveling for a while, she'd know how he thinks in a Pokemon battle, especially since she was the one helping him with his battling skills.

In other words, there was a possibility that she'd crush him in an all-out Pokemon battle.

"However..." Misty said with reassurance in her voice; "For this battle, it'll be different from a regular gym battle.. The point of our battle won't be for you to beat me. It'll be to test your skill, and how well you apply it. If I think you've proven your skill well enough, the match ends with you winning the badge!"

Ash relaxed a bit more but was still nervous regardless.

Misty's sisters and Brock looked at her with astonishment but ultimately didn't object.
-------

Everyone went to the pool, where everything was getting set up for the battle.

Before Ash went to his side of the pool, Violet walked up to him a bit sneakily. Proceeding to try and give him a wedgie. As she reached out Ash suddenly turned and pulled her forward by her arm which caused Violet to fall on her stomach.

"Oof! Wh- AAH!! ow! Ow! OW!!" Before Violet could do anything, Ash yanked her panties over her back, over her head and snapped her waistband to her forehead.

"If you know what's good for you, you'll avoid doing that again," Ash said as he talked off and made his to the poolside. Leaving Violet to lay weakly on the ground in her atomic wedgie. "owowow... eh, my poor butt.... well, eh this is new... ow..."

Soon enough, Misty stood across on the other side of the pool from Ash, who appeared to be doing his best to ignore the voice in his head as she instructed him back in Pewter.

"This match will allow only two Pokemon each! If the challenger shows enough skill that Misty deems satisfactory, then he will earn the Cerulean gym badge! Let the battle... BEGIN!"
1152112111112222211211121111211211111121.title: She'll battle Ash.

1152112111112222211211121111211211111121.content:
While nervous to be battling his mentor, even if he wasn't expected to win, Ash did know that he had at least one advantage. While he wasn't exactly the practically guaranteed win that Misty's sisters had called him, Pikachu's electric power would give him a good leg up and head start in the fight. "Alright, Pikachu, I choose you!" he called out with his arm outstretched as Pikachu... wasn't there. "Huh?"

"Pika." the electric mouse popped up from behind his left shoulder.

Ash smiled as he saw his small friend. "Oh, there you are." Well, now let's-"

"Pika Pi."

"Uh, is something wrong?" Ash was rather confused and hoping that nothing bad had suddenly happened to Pikachu. Said Pokemon began explaining, by which I mean saying its name in different tones and gesturing about randomly, the issue. "Soooo, you're saying you don't wanna fight Misty because she's our friend?"

"Pika." A nod.

Misty stared in bewilderment, wondering how this kid seemed to attract so many odd Pokemon. It was only a bit strange when Pikachu seemed to absolutely HATE the idea of going into a Pokeball, but now there's this. Not to mention that whole thing with Vaporeon.

The redhead was about to say something, only to be cut off by Ash, "So can you tell me why?" he asked his Pikachu calmly."

He got a few more gestures and bit of Pokemon speech in response.

"So, you're worried about hurting her Pokemon?" He got a nod in response and, much to Misty's surprise, smiled. "You are really are nice little guy, aren't ya?" Pikachu smiled a bit and nodded while awkwardly scratching its head with its tail. "Still, you don't have to worry about that." he said while petting Pikachu a bit." Just think of this as a spar, not a fight. Friends do that all the time." Pikachu seemed to be mulling that over for a moment before Ash said one more thing that he knew would spur Pikachu on to fight. "Besides, I'd be a little more worried about them hurting you, buddy."

Shock briefly took over Pikachu's face as he let out a confused "Pika?"

"Well yeah, I know you're an electric type and all, but Misty's water Pokemon are WAY more experienced." Misty smiled from where she was standing as she heard Ash say this. "I'm just not so sure you'd be up to the challenge."

"Pika! Pikachu! Pika Pi. Pikachu!" the small mouse said fiercely and with confidence while gesturing towards Misty, himself, and then Ash.

"You sure?" ash asked. Receiving a particularly loud "PIKA" in response. "Alright then, let's see what you've got!" Ash said as Pikachu moved forward, ready to battle.

Misty smiled, proud of how Ash handled the situation with his Pikachu.
1152112111112222211211121111211211111121.title: Ash shows Misty what he's learned

1152112111112222211211121111211211111121.content:
"All right... NOW, we can begin!" Daisy said, with annoyance from the interruption.
---

As soon as the announcement was made, Misty brought out a Pokeball, pressing the button to enlarge it. She gave Ash a stern look that told him that he better be ready, making sure that he understood the importance of this gym battle.

"Misty calls.... Seel!"

And just like that, a white light flashed out of the opened Pokeball and onto a platform until it stopped, revealing the seal-like Pokemon.

Wasting no time, Ash immediately started off by attempting the first attack, ordering Pikachu to launch a thunderbolt.

Just as Pikachu launched it, however, Seel already dived into the pool, avoiding the electric attack.

Both the trainer and his electric mouse gaped at the pinniped Pokemon's reflexes. But both snapped out of it, just in time for Pikachu to quickly duck under a headbutt from Seel, which had such speed and power that Pikachu's fur could feel a breeze blow against it.

As soon as Seel splashed back into the water, Pikachu scampered to the next platform on his right.

Only for Seel to stealthily climb onto the platform Pikachu was on and toss him into the air with his head (thankfully not using his horn), and immediately slapped him away with his tail.

Pikachu naturally launched a thunderbolt in mid-air as retaliation, which hit right on point. Pikachu then landed on a platform in a quadrupedal stance, as nimbly as a cat would.

Misty had Seel use aqua ring to recover from the electric attack to a degree.

Retaliating immediately, after getting hit. Even used Seel's slap to gain some distance... Not bad! Misty thought to herself; But now, it's time to stop prodding...

Soon, Seel dove into the water again and launched a water pulse at Pikachu, who leapt over it. Not wanting to give Pikachu time to retaliate again, Seel chased after him while lobbing water pulse after water pulse.Thankfully, Pikachu was ordered to use agility to better avoid the watery spheres. But even still, Seel was keeping Pikachu from using his electric attacks.

Ash was sweating bullets, as he could only watch as Pikachu was being chased around the pool, unable to send out a single thunderbolt as he scampered onto platform after platform.

Then of course, Misty grew tired of this impromptu game of "ring-around-the-rosie" and had Seel use blizzard on one of the platforms Pikachu was about to leap on. The sea lion Pokemon obeyed and leapt out of the water, blowing a gust of chilled air from his mouth onto the surface of the platform and creating a sheet of ice. Pikachu couldn't stop himself from landing on it in time, unfortunately.

Because Pikachu was struggling to get his footing back, Seel was given ample time to slam his larger body against Pikachu, sending him flying across the pool. Seel dove into the water and swam quickly, managing to leap into the air and intercepted Pikachu by spiking him into the water with his tail.

It was now or never! if Ash didn't think of something now, Pikachu wouldn't be able to get even a single attack in before getting knocked out.

That is, until a lightbulb flashed into his head.

"Pikachu, wait for my signal!" Ash said.

"Pi-i chuuu Pikapi, Pi pikaa Kaa..."

[Translation: All right Ash, I trust you...]

And so Pikachu waited as Seel swam at him like a torpedo, getting closer and closer... Until...

"Now, use thunderbolt while still in the pool!" Ash said.

Misty couldn't order Seel to get out of the pool in time, as he was still charging. Even though his headbutt connected solidly and sent Pikachu flying, Pikachu was still able to send out currents of electricity throughout the water at the moment of impact, giving Seel a good shock.

Pikachu landed on a platform, almost like a ragdoll in contrast to his agile movements from before.

Seel, on the other hand (flipper?), just barely had enough strength to stay conscious and stay afloat, though the blubber coated on his his body did manage to slightly insulate him from the electricity, So regardless of his severely weakened state, he was still declared the winner, as Pikachu fainted.

"Man, who knew our little sister could kick so much butt in a Pokemon battle?" Lily said, her eyes widening with astonishment.

"She even got around the type advantage the squirt's Pikachu had!" Violet exclaimed.

Brock, of course, wasn't surprised in the slightest. Considering that Ash did the same thing during Pidgeotto's bout with Geodude, it was only natural that Misty could also do it; though to a greater degree, anyway.

Ash, leapt onto the platforms until he got to Pikachu, lifting the little guy into his arms. Pikachu regained consciousness, giving him a little thumbs up to show that he wasn't discouraged from getting beaten by a water Pokemon. Ash smiled while he carried him off of the pool.

"You were awesome out there, bud. Way I see it, you deserve a good long rest..."
--

After Pikachu was handed to Brock, Ash went back to the pool, and got out his pokeball. Thankfully, due getting severely shocked by pikachu's thunderbolt in the pool, Misty wasn't going to use Seel for the next round.

So now, it all came down to one Pokemon each...

Pidgeotto was somewhat out of the question, considering that despite having no weakness against water type moves, he still likely wouldn't fare well if his wings got too wet. Metapod's mobility was somewhat restricted, so he was a no go. This of course, left Ash with only one viable option.

"All right Vaporeon, let's show Misty what ya got!"

When Vaporeon came out of her Pokeball and was on a platform, she looked around until she saw Ash and gave him a questioning look.

After Ash explained what was going on, Vaporeon nodded in understanding and turned around, ready for her first gym bout.

Misty opened a Pokeball, calling out the occupant inside.

Ash swallowed a lump in his throat as he looked at Vaporeon's opponent, whom he had every right to be nervous of. Who was it you ask?

Why, a seaking, of course!

Despite not having the gyrados' fearsome reputation; any wildlife expert, Pokemon researcher, fisherman , and those that survive an attack would tell you that these horned fish are not to be taken lightly.

1.) Seakings are powerful swimmers. They can not only swim against a river's current, but they're even able to swim up a waterfall.

2.) That single horn on a seaking's head isn't for show; it's a deadly weapon that trainers must hope to never be on the receiving end of, due to it being powerful enough to bore holes through boulders.

Ash did his best to calm his nerves as he got himself ready.
1152112111112222211211121111211211111121.title: Now the battle REALLY begins.

choices: Misty has a few words with her sisters, and Ash and Misty celebrate
1152112111112222211211121111211211111121.content:
Ash knew that this battle was going to be difficult. Misty had a clear advantage. As such, he decided to be cautious, waiting for Misty to make the first. And move she did! "Seaking, Horn attack!"

The dangerous fish rushed forward straight toward Vaporeon, who, at Ash's command, dodged and fired a water gun the was easily avoided by Seaking. "Darn it," Ash muttered.

"You'll have to do better than that Ash. Now, Poison Jab!"

Fortunately for Ash, Vaporeon was just as quick to dodge this time as last. Even better, an idea was forming in the boy's mind.

"Water Gun," Misty called out.

"Dodge, and then circle around under Seaking."

"Huh?" Misty watched as Vaporeon dodged and swam under Seaking, coming out on the opposite of the fish. Deciding not to give Ash a moment to think, she called out, "Horn attack!" Playing defense won't work for long Ash.

Again Ash had Vapoeon dodge oddly, this time having her dive down and actually jump over Seaking's attack before calling out "Water Gun."

Again Seaking avoided the move, and Misty, getting a bit irritated by this battle turning into a game of Meowth and Ratata, yelled, "Seaking keep chasing Vaporeon and don't use Megahorn attack until you get close."

Seeing the opportunity he was waiting for yelled, "Dive, get him following you, then swim straight up as fast as you can!"

"Really, still running Ash?" she asked, honestly surprised. What is he up to?

She got her answer soon enough as the inevitable result of their commands happened. Vaporeon leaped up from the water, actually managing to go up a good four feet with how fast it was moving, with Seaking following behind with his horn glowing and, thanks to his superior speed, closing the distance fast. "Tailwhip him straight upward!" Ash yelled out.

"What?" Misty watched as Vaporeon did an odd turn in the air before striking Seaking with her tail and, combined with the momentum it already had, knocked him straight up to the ceiling for a hard collision as Vaporeon landed back in the water.

"Keep him up there with water gun!" Vaporeon obeyed, knocking the fish back into the ceiling with the blast of water. Once Seaking started falling again, Ash called out for a tackle which Vaporeon managed to land on the now seriously dazed fish. It probably didn't help that Misty seemed just as dazed with surprise.

Just as Vaporeon was about to retreat away, Misty gave a few claps, causing her to pause and Ash and the others to stare at her. "Okay, I am officially impressed." Granted her Seaking definitely still looked battle-ready, if a little beaten up. In fact, he looked like he wanted nothing more than to be given an attack command so that he could get some much-deserved revenge for the embarrassment he just suffered.

"Uh, you are?" Ash asked.

"After a maneuver like that?" she asked rhetorically. "Yes, definitely yes," she said with pride. "Although I have no idea what would inspire you to weaponize the gym's ceiling like that." She laughed a bit as she said that last part.

Ash let out an elated cheer in response.

What happens next?
1152112111112222211211121111211211111121.title: Round 2

choices: The next day, Misty's sisters say their farewells
1152112111112222211211121111211211111121.content:
While Ash and Brock were playing with their Pokemon, with Ash having won the Cerulean gym badge, things were pretty cheerful.

Misty looked at Ash with a warm smile on her face, beyond glad to know that the boy was making progress as a trainer. And what's more? There was a twinkle in his eye that practically glowed with exuberance from having not just earned his badge, but from actually impressing his coach/mentor.

He still had a long way to go, but she had a feeling that the boy would be going places in the future. All he had to was to keep at it is all.

"Hey, uh, sis? Could we talk to you in private?" Violet asked as she tapped Misty's shoulder.

"Hmm?" Misty turned around and saw all three of her big sisters standing in front of her. "Sure, what about?"

"Something important..." Daisy said.
--

After the four sisters walked out of the room with the pool, the talk began.

"Soooo, after we watched your match with your boyfriend, we just gotta say something..." Lily,

Normally, Misty would've reminded her (or protest, whichever) that Ash wasn't her boyfriend, but she let it slide since this talk was so important.

"You showed some incredible skill at Pokemon battling out there Misty..." Daisy said; "I've never seen anyone take control of a battle the way you did. In the first round alone, you showed quick thinking, coordination with your Pokemon, and even got around an opponent's type advantage to a degree I hadn't seen before!"

"What's more? You showed a great judge in skill from seeing the way Ash battled. Heck, the kid's not too shabby of a battler himself, especially since he's learning under you. He's still a dork outside of that, but still!" Lily said with a giggle at the last part.

"How come you never told us you were this good?" Violet asked.

"Well, I... Um..." Misty hadn't predicted this at all. But thankfully, she regained her composure; "See, there've been people that compared me with you, to the point where I just had enough of it! I wasn't going to stop being a mallet wielding tomboy just to please them, so I decided to hone my battling skills in private so I could become a water pokemon master... That way, I could become more than what THEY wanted... Yeah, sounds sappy and stupid, but that's how I feel..."

Her sisters looked at her, their faces softening.

Daisy suddenly gently pulled her youngest sister into a hug; "I'm beyond sorry Misty... We never knew what you were going through!"

"We don't care if you're not into 'girly' stuff like us. Nor your mallet, strength or how you're better at wedging us in our wedgie wars. We don't want anyone to try and dictate who you should be!" Violet joined in. "If anyone's got a problem, they can just get in line for a royal butt-kicking from us!"

"You're our sister Mist..." Lily said as she joined. "We'll always love you for who YOU are, tomboy or otherwise! What matters most is that you stay true to your heart! And from the way I see it, Ash and Brock feel the way about you..."

Misty's eyes widened as if time had stopped while her older sisters hugged her tenderly. Eventually, she gave a big smile and let tears of joy fall down as she hugged her sisters.
---

Later, at the inn in the evening, Ash and Misty were in their room, where the girl was just finished getting changed into a new pair of red panties with blue zigzag patterns on them. She then came out, now clad in only the undies and nothing else towards Ash.

"Definitely made the right call with these..." Ash smirked as he gently tugged on the waistband, letting them snap back after releasing them. "What do you think, Misty-girl?"

"They actually feel kinda nice, in all honesty..." Misty said, smiling as her cheeks turned pink.

"Good! Now, time to see if how long they last in my hands..." Ash said, giving a cat-like grin as he cracked his knuckles.

Without even needing to be ordered, Misty turned around and showed her butt to Ash. The boy then proceeded with ever so slowly grabbing the waistband with an underhand grip in preparation. Soon enough, Ash had hefted the young trainer off the floor in one clean jerk upwards towards the ceiling.

Misty squeaked as Ash suspended her by her panties, the material painfully digging into her. Strangely enough, she wasn't resistant to it as usual... Could it be that she was growing accustomed to them?

"Hey, Mist?" Ash said as he held her up; "I still haven't thanked you... For making me a better trainer..."

"Give yourself, eh, some credit Ash..." Misty winced; "You still put in 120% percent, eh... that's bound to make help you in the long run!... Besides ... By training you, I think I'm getting better myself..."

Ash smiled; "So... We're basically helping each other?" Ash gave the girl a little bounce, as a means of sinking the panties deeper.

"Eep! Yeah... eh, I guess you could say that..." Misty bit her lower lip from the material digging into her.
1152112111112222211211121111211211111121.title: Misty has a few words with her sisters, and Ash...

choices: Ash takes Misty to buy some extra panties for her before they leave.
1152112111112222211211121111211211111121.content:
Ash smiled. It was nice knowing that their arrangement was helping her out so much.

Of course, He couldn't let a moment like this continue for long. "Alright, enough of the sappy stuff," he said while giving her panties another sharp pull and making her squeak. "Let's see how much it will take to get you squirming."

"Ah! Oh god!" she gasped out as Ash spun her around a couple of times by her undies. "Probably less tha-EHHHNn you think!" Suddenly Ash stopped mid-spin and stepped back while giving a strong pull, letting the momentum further pull on the girl's underwear. "YEOWWW!" With his strength, he then tossed her face-first onto her bed.

"Well, that's good," he said walking up behind her and grabbing her waistband again. "It wouldn't be quite as much fun otherwise." Pulling up, he briefly lifted the girl off the bed before dropping her back down as she whimpered, shaking just a little bit. "Ooh, shaking. Nice, it makes that little butt of yours look even cuter." As if to emphasize his point, he then gave her a strong swat on the aforementioned butt."

"Ah!. Th-thanks..." she said, uncertain and blushing like crazy. Oh man, how is this still so embarrassing? Her embarrassment and worry grew when she felt him slide his left arm through the leg-holes of her panties. "A-ash, what are you doing?"

"Isn't it obvious?"

MIsty quickly found herself lifted completely off the bed, squealing as Ash curled and uncurled his arm

"I'm doing some weight-lifting."

The next day...

While Brock was getting a new map, as Misty had thrown the previous one into the campfire on the journey to the city during one of her attempts to stall, Ash and Misty were outside the Cerulien gym saying goodbye to Lily, Daisy, and Violet.

"It really was great seeing you again sis."

"Yeah, and we hope you have a great journey."

"And feel free to tell us about it the next time you're here."

Misty smiled. "Thanks, you guys. And I will."

Suddenly, Violet turned towards Ash. "Hey, Ash..."

"Huh? What is it?" he asked. Violet then whispered into his ear which made him smirk. "I don't have time but I can show you one where we all do it."

Ash then turned to Misty, "Hey Misty, close your eyes"

"Umm... ok..."Misty was confused but did so.

For a while, she heard whispering, and then nothing, that was until...

Suddenly, the girl felt four, yes four, sets of hands all grab her panties and yank upward. "OWWWWWWHOWowow!"

Combined, and grabbing from all sides, Ash and her sisters managed to yank her panties up to just below her chest in one go. And after some pulling, while she futilely struggled to get free, they managed to get her panties up to the top of her head. They then let go causing the back of her waistband to snap on her forehead and the front of her waistband to snap at the back of her head. Giving a brutal double atomic wedgie.

Misty fall to the ground and held are crotch in pain.

"Yikes!" Violet began. "That is definitely worse than the wedgie I received"

"I wanna be given that" Dasiy muttered

"I'm definitely using this in our next wedgie war," added Lily. "Seriously Misty you have a boyfriend who could really teach you. I wish I had a boyfriend who could..."

Hehe, well..." Ash smiled and rubbed the back of his head awkwardly. Then his mind finally processed the word "boyfriend" again and he seethed a bit internally.

Misty, meanwhile, held her crotch with only one thought in her mind. Really?! They think Ash would be good boyfriend material. And it has to be because of this! Well, that and her currently immense discomfort.

What will happen next?

Option 1: On their journey to the next town, while Brock puts some kind of meal together, Misty and Ash move away from the campsite to practice more with his Pokemon.
1152112111112222211211121111211211111121.title: The next day, Misty's sisters say their fa...

choices: "Bulbasaur and the Hidden Village" - Wedgie edition
1152112111112222211211121111211211111121.content:
It's been at least a day or two since the trio started their trek from Cerulean, with Misty still feeling a bit of phantom pain from the super wedgie that Ash and her sisters had given her before they left.

Vermillion was still a town over or so, but despite the long journey, Ash wasn't discouraged in the slightest. It kept his companions in good spirits, who gladly welcomed his infectious optimism. Misty especially, considering that outside of the wedgies she received from the young trainer, she had also grown rather fond of him.

Brock was especially important for the two, considering his talents as a cook and his perchance for being the "big brother" of the group. Save for his occasional "girl-crazy mode", he was usually the one acting as the voice of reason in moments where It was needed. It helped that he seems to have more experience with surviving out in the wilderness, likely a result of his father's teachings as well as having to take his siblings camping on occasion.

Speaking of which... Brock was already at work cooking dinner.

When asked how long it'd take, he wagered it to be around at least three hours or so, given the preparation required for the recipe he was using.

Misty opted to go out training with Ash to pass the time training, with Pikachu staying behind to help guard the camp.
----

"All right Ash, I think for today, you should bring out Metapod," Misty said. "He could use the exercise... Though I don't know how he'd even be able to move around... Anyway, back on topic! Why don't you try and see if you can improve on the things he knows?..."

Ash nodded meekly. He then proceeded with calling Metapod out of the Pokeball.

The bug type jumped into the air a bit with joy, though how he could do this without legs is a mystery.

Anyway, training began with Ash having Metapod improve the accuracy of his string shot by firing globs of the sticky stuff at some leaves on a branch.
-------

This continued for a little while now, with Misty having not made a move on him yet. What's more?

Sometime, after Ash and Metapod took a bit of a break. She seemed to have disappeared who knew how many minutes ago while Ash was doing target practice with his little green pal. Ash had no clue what was up, though he figured she went out to see if she could find a water Pokemon to catch...

The instant that Ash and Metapod got back into training, this time with tackle attack, they didn't even notice that someone was watching them from the trees. Someone wearing a camouflaged jumpsuit, along with a full face mask that completely concealed the face and hair; as well as gloves.

Silently but stealthily, the figure slowly crept up closer and closer, until they suddenly grabbed Ash from behind and yanked him backward by his jacket.

"H-hey, what the heck?!"

Metapod immediately rushed to his trainer's defense and tackled the person away, only to get pushed away as retaliation and landed on his side.

Ash immediately returned Metapod' to his Pokeball. While Metapod didn't look like he was hurt, he didn't want to risk his Pokemon getting injured for his sake needlessly. This turned out to be a big mistake, as the mysterious newcomer looked at him, and slowly walked towards him.

Gulping with fright, Ash slowly walked backward. Further and further he kept his distance from the figure until he turned tail and ran, with his pursuer doing their best to make sure he didn't getaway.

The chase lasted about two minutes, with Ash sweating nervously as he tried unsuccessfully to shake them off while running through various shrubbery. All this came to a close when he tried to dart to the side, only for him to be tackled to the ground by the figure.

After a brief struggle, Ash actually managed to gain the upper hand. He grabbed the figure the best on his/her camouflaged bottom and brought him/her to his/her feet as they stood up. This caused the jumpsuit to rip revealing the figure to be wearing blue panties with green swirl design patterns.

Without missing a beat Ash went into action, giving a strong enough pull to yank the figure and cause her to squeal. Before anything could be said Ash then dragged the squealing figure to a rock formation with a particularly curved shape stone on the side. Ash hooked the figure's panties to the stone, hefting her off and letting her dangle from the stone.

The figure yelped as gravity went to work on her but then admits her struggling, Ash heard the figure give familiar "ow...". Ash then proceeded to pull her mask off to reveal...

"Misty?!"

Misty winced. "Yeah... eh, it's me, ow... ta-da... ow"

Ash watched as she squirmed around as she hung by her undies; "W-what the heck is-"

"It's part of the training... eh, Basically, I pretend to be someone who wants to kidnap you... eh, and you attempt to escape. But you returned Metapod to his Pokeball...eh when he was still very well capable of defending you. Plus, you know very well he can use harden... So, mind telling me why you made such a boneheaded move?!"

"I-I...... I didn't want to risk Metapod getting seriously hurt because of me... I... I don't think I can deal with something like that, not like when Pikachu risked himself to stop the spearrow from nearly killing me! I...... I don't want that to ever happen again!"

Misty looked up at him with sympathy, while still hanging she put both hands gently on Ash's shoulders.

"Ash... I..... Look, I know how much you care about every single one of your Pokemon. But you gotta realize that they care just as much about you as you do them; because you've shown them nothing but love, affection, and encouragement. That to them is what makes YOU so valuable in the first place!" Misty said; "If they want to protect you, then they'll do it, regardless of the risks. It's not something that you can stop Ash... Any more than you can catch lightning in a bottle.."

In the time that Ash was given to mull over these words, and proceeding to get Misty down from the rock formation. The two heard a rustling that came closer, louder until a wild and rather grouchy Pinsir came into view.

Apparently, the bug type Pokemon wasn't a big fan of the idea of humans being in his territory. Just as Misty was about to send out a water Pokemon, however, Metapod popped out of his Pokeball and attempted to the tackle, only to get smacked away for his troubles.

Metapod thankfully used harden to avoid the impact from slamming into a tree. But the Pinsir seemed intent on using his horns to do him in, so naturally, Ash attempted to distract him by throwing a stone. Just as the Pinsir turned to face him, Metapod suddenly glowed, with his shell opening up to reveal-

"Butterfree, the Butterfly Pokémon. Butterfree is the evolved form of Metapod. Its wings, covered with poisonous powders, repel water. This allows it to fly in the rain" Dexter's electronic voice resounded.

Ash and Misty couldn't believe what they saw before them, as Butterfree flew in front of Ash and Misty protectively. Just as the Pinsir charged, however, Butterfree suddenly used string shot to immobilize him.
Just as the stag beetle Pokemon had gotten loose, Butterfree than flapped his wings and used sleep powder to naturally put him to sleep.

Butterfree floated over to Ash, nuzzling him affectionately.

Ash smiled big time as he pat his Pokemon on the head.

"Brock is not gonna believe this..." Misty murmured to herself as she fixed her wedgie...
1152112111112222211211121111211211111121.title: Option 1

choices: ..., likely unintentionally, leave Misty in a wedgie.
1152112111112222211211121111211211111121.content:
Our heroes were having a... well, in all honesty, it wasn't that weird a day all things considered. Yes, a Bulbasaur coming out of no where to protect an Oddish from being caught wasn't exactly normal, but was pretty tame when compared to a lot of things that travelers can come across. In fact, this bridge was probably weirder than that.

"It's odd, I don't see this anywhere on the map." Brock said, studying and turning around the map in his hands.

"Yeah, and why is it a rope bridge?" Ash asked. That got him a couple of confused stares.

"Uhhh, what?" Asked Brock.

"It's a bridge over rushing rapids and big rocks." The boy explained, stating the obvious. "You'd think whoever built it would make something sturdier and less likely to get taken down by a strong wind." Brock and Misty thought for a moment before nodding in agreement.

Of course, that also prompted worry from Misty. "Brock, do you see any other paths over this thing on the map?"

"I don't even see this one on here." he answered. "Huh, the bridge must be new or something."

Looking over the bridge, Ash briefly weighed their chances of getting across. What's the worst that could happen?

42 and a half seconds later...

"Ooookay, irrr, and... I'm up!" Ash grunted out as he climbed off of Misty and onto steady ground on the other side of the now wrecked bridge."

"Great. How 'bout giving me a hand?" Misty asked, still hanging to the wrecked bridge and trying to pull herself the rest of the way.

"Right." Ash said, crouching down and reaching his right hand towards her left... and then past it towards her butt.

"Oh come o-owhowhowhowoW!" Misty shouted as Ash grabbed the exposed waistband of her panties and hoisted her the rest of the way up by those. "Ow! is this really the-Yeowch! Sorry, sorry!" she backpedaled her complaining as he started bouncing her.

"It's always a good time for a wedgie Misty."

With that settled, the two soon moved on to figuring out where the water had likely carried Brock to. unfortunately, they would be setting off a few traps along the way. Traps that would somehow...
1152112111112222211211121111211211111121.title: "Bulbasaur and the Hidden Village" Wedgie edition

choices: The mysterious girl introduces herself, and the hidden secret she protects.
1152112111112222211211121111211211111121.content:
Misty, Ash, and Pikachu walked on as they searched for Brock. So far, they had been walking for at least half an hour, with next to no clues found at the moment.

To make matters worse, things had gotten just a tad too quiet around here.

"Misty.... Do you think whoever put up that bridge wanted to...? You know.." Ash drew his index finger across his throat.

"Probably... Though not out of malice..." Misty' foot unknowingly stepped on something hidden underneath a couple of leaves; "Probably wanted to-OH CRAP!!"

Misty immediately grabbed Ash and pulled him down with her to the grass, ducking just in time to avoid getting slammed into by a log on a rope.

Their eyes bugged out of surprise and fear, thanking their lucky stars and reflexes for avoiding such a collision.

"Ash, I think we better keep moving" Misty asked herself as she and Ash got to their feet and made a run for it.
--

The trio dodged rocks thrown at them, narrowly avoided a pit, and other such obstacles... The next one was a tad more embarrassing, however...

As soon as Misty had stepped on another hidden trigger, she narrowly avoided getting slammed by another log, though the seat of her shorts, unfortunately, got caught on a branch as it flew by. The log naturally dragged the screaming girl along, who was now, unfortunately, hanging by her shorts.

Just as Ash and Pikachu were about to run over and help the girl out, they fell to the ground, courtesy of bolas that were thrown and wrapped around their feet.

"Don't even think about moving..." Said a girl with dark blue hair in a braid and hair ribbon, wearing red overalls over a pink shirt. She stood over Ash, with a double barreled shotgun pointed at him.

Now, Ash may have been stronger than the girl... But with the shotgun pointed so up close to his face, he probably wouldn't be able to retaliate effectively without getting a face full of pellets. So of course, Ash complied.

"Where do you people get off... Thinking you can just come in here and steal innocent Pokemon from their homes whenever you want. The nerve!" The girl said with a growl.

"Who do you think we are, Team Rocket?! I would never do what those poachers do!" Ash said angrily.

The girl with the gun paused in thought as she studied Ash's reaction. Slowly putting the gun away, the girl moved cautiously and proceeded to undo the bolas that tied up Ash and Pikachu.

"Sorry about that... I'm... Well... I'll explain later... First, we need to get your friend down from there..."

She pointed a thumb up towards poor Misty as she hung by the seat of her shorts in what looked to be an uncomfortable wedgie, courtesy of the branch on the log.
